Subject: Curious behavior in case of soft 404 for robots.txt

In a domain crawl of the .is domain I noticed the following line in the cra=
wl log:

2011-03-30T08:59:26.475Z   200   20576312 http://www.brooklyngener=
al.com/pdf/Brooklyn_General.m4v LLLXPE http://www.brooklyngeneral.com/robot=
s.txt text/plain #014 20110330085759469+84350 sha1:3EJFU737DCJRA6JABKJSOZQ3=
DGWM2QCH http://www.hugmyndahus.is/

The crawl is configured to fetch embed=
ded content that is otherwise outside of scope. In this instance a site see=
ms to have embedded something from www.brooklyngeneral.com causing Heritrix=
 to fetch its robots.txt rules. However, the site does not have a robots.tx=
t and instead responds with a soft 404 serving up its frontpage, which in t=
urn embeds the video file in question.

Clearly, this is a vector for unwan=
ted scope leakage, but I'm unsure how to prevent it. Perhaps Heritrix shoul=
d regard robots.txt responses that are not text/plain (and perhaps fail to =
be parsed as robots.txt rules) differently (skipping link extraction). Or p=
erhaps this can be dealt with in scoping (i.e. if P is in discovery path an=
d you're outside primary scope then rule the URL out -- although this seems=
 complicated to implement).

I'd welcome any thoughts on the subject.

- Kr=
